From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin iūrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [ʒuˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [d͡ʒuˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

jurar (first-person singular present juro, first-person singular preterite jurí, past participle jurat)

  1. to swear, to promise
  2. to affirm
    Synonyms: afirmar, assegurar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of jurar (first conjugation)
infinitive jurar
gerund jurant
past participle masculine feminine
singular jurat jurada
plural jurats jurades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present juro jures jura jurem jureu juren
imperfect jurava juraves jurava juràvem juràveu juraven
future juraré juraràs jurarà jurarem jurareu juraran
preterite jurí jurares jurà juràrem juràreu juraren
conditional juraria juraries juraria juraríem juraríeu jurarien

vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present juri juris juri jurem jureu jurin
imperfect jurés juressis jurés juréssim juréssiu juressin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — jura juri jurem jureu jurin
negative (no) — no juris no juri no jurem no jureu no jurin

Related terms

[edit]
  • jurament
  • jurat

References

[edit]
  • “jurar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “jurar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “jurar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “jurar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Occitan jurar, from Latin jūrāre, iūrāre (“to swear”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

jurar

  1. to promise; to swear

Conjugation

Old Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin jūrāre, iūrāre (“to swear”).

Verb

[edit]

jurar

  1. to promise; to swear

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese jurar, from Latin jūrāre, iūrāre (“to swear”), from Proto-Italic *jowezāō, from Proto-Indo-European *h₂yew-.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾa(ʁ)/ [ʒuˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾa(ʁ)/ [ʒuˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾa(ʁ)/ [ʒuˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ʒuˈɾa.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: ju‧rar

Verb

[edit]

jurar (first-person singular present juro, first-person singular preterite jurei, past participle jurado)

  1. to swear (take an oath)
    Synonyms: afirmar, assegurar, asseverar, garantir, juramentar, prometer
    • 1928, Sinhô, “Jura [Swear]”‎[1] (SP record), performed by Aracy Cortes, Rio de Janeiro: Odeon Records:
      Jura, jura, jura pelo Senhor / Jura, pela imagem da Santa Cruz do Redentor / Pra ter valor a tua jura / Jura, jura de coração
      Swear, swear, swear by the Lord / Swear, by the image of the Redeemer's Holy Cross / For thine oath to bear worth / Swear, swear wholeheartedly

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of jurar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • jura
  • jurado
  • jurador
  • juramentado
  • juramentar
  • juramento

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Spanish iurar, from Latin iūrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /xuˈɾaɾ/ [xuˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Venezuela):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ju‧rar

Verb

[edit]

jurar (first-person singular present juro, first-person singular preterite juré, past participle jurado)

  1. (transitive) to swear; to take an oath
    Ha jurado guardarlo secreto
    He has sworn to keep it secret
  2. (intransitive) to curse or swear

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of jurar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive jurar
gerund jurando
past participle masculine feminine
singular jurado jurada
plural jurados juradas
singular plural

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
